summary: Program to collect error metrics on bases stratified in various ways.

arguments.summary: read one or more arguments files and add them to the command line
arguments.name: --arguments_file

arguments.summary: Compression level for all compressed files created (e.g. BAM and VCF).
arguments.name: --COMPRESSION_LEVEL

arguments.summary: Whether to create an index when writing VCF or coordinate sorted BAM output.
arguments.name: --CREATE_INDEX

arguments.summary: Whether to create an MD5 digest for any BAM or FASTQ files created.
arguments.name: --CREATE_MD5_FILE

arguments.summary: Errors to collect in the form of "ERROR(:STRATIFIER)*". To see the values available for ERROR and STRATIFIER look at the documentation for the arguments ERROR_VALUE and STRATIFIER_VALUE.
arguments.name: --ERROR_METRICS
arguments.defaultValue: [ERROR, ERROR:BASE_QUALITY, ERROR:INSERT_LENGTH, ERROR:GC_CONTENT, ERROR:READ_DIRECTION, ERROR:PAIR_ORIENTATION, ERROR:HOMOPOLYMER, ERROR:BINNED_HOMOPOLYMER, ERROR:CYCLE, ERROR:READ_ORDINALITY, ERROR:READ_ORDINALITY:CYCLE, ERROR:READ_ORDINALITY:HOMOPOLYMER, ERROR:READ_ORDINALITY:GC_CONTENT, ERROR:READ_ORDINALITY:PRE_DINUC, ERROR:MAPPING_QUALITY, ERROR:READ_GROUP, ERROR:MISMATCHES_IN_READ, ERROR:ONE_BASE_PADDED_CONTEXT, OVERLAPPING_ERROR, OVERLAPPING_ERROR:BASE_QUALITY, OVERLAPPING_ERROR:INSERT_LENGTH, OVERLAPPING_ERROR:READ_ORDINALITY, OVERLAPPING_ERROR:READ_ORDINALITY:CYCLE, OVERLAPPING_ERROR:READ_ORDINALITY:HOMOPOLYMER, OVERLAPPING_ERROR:READ_ORDINALITY:GC_CONTENT, INDEL_ERROR]

arguments.summary: A fake argument used to show the options of ERROR (in ERROR_METRICS).
arguments.name: --ERROR_VALUE

options.summary: Collects the average (SNP) error at the bases provided. Suffix is: 'error'.
options.name: ERROR

options.summary: Only considers bases from the overlapping parts of reads from the same template. For those bases, it calculates the error that can be attributable to pre-sequencing, versus during-sequencing. Suffix is: 'overlapping_error'.
options.name: OVERLAPPING_ERROR

options.summary: Collects insertion and deletion errors at the bases provided. Suffix is: 'indel_error'.
options.name: INDEL_ERROR

arguments.summary: Google Genomics API client_secrets.json file path.
arguments.name: --GA4GH_CLIENT_SECRETS

arguments.summary: display the help message
arguments.name: --help

arguments.summary: Input SAM or BAM file.
arguments.name: --INPUT

arguments.summary: Iterate through the file assuming it consists of a pre-created subset interval of the full genome.  This enables fast processing of files with reads at disperate parts of the genome.  Requires that the provided VCF file is indexed.
arguments.name: --INTERVAL_ITERATOR

arguments.summary: Region(s) to limit analysis to. Supported formats are VCF or interval_list. Will *intersect* inputs if multiple are given. When this argument is supplied, the VCF provided must be *indexed*.
arguments.name: --INTERVALS

arguments.summary: Size of location bins. Used by the FLOWCELL_X and FLOWCELL_Y stratifiers
arguments.name: --LOCATION_BIN_SIZE

arguments.summary: Shortest homopolymer which is considered long.  Used by the BINNED_HOMOPOLYMER stratifier.
arguments.name: --LONG_HOMOPOLYMER

arguments.summary: Maximum number of loci to process (or unlimited if 0).
arguments.name: --MAX_LOCI

arguments.summary: When writing files that need to be sorted, this will specify the number of records stored in RAM before spilling to disk. Increasing this number reduces the number of file handles needed to sort the file, and increases the amount of RAM needed.
arguments.name: --MAX_RECORDS_IN_RAM

arguments.summary: Minimum base quality to include base.
arguments.name: --MIN_BASE_Q

arguments.summary: Minimum mapping quality to include read.
arguments.name: --MIN_MAPPING_Q

arguments.summary: Base name for output files. Actual file names will be generated from the basename and suffixes from the ERROR and STRATIFIER by adding a '.' and then error_by_stratifier[_and_stratifier]* where 'error' is ERROR's extension, and 'stratifier' is STRATIFIER's suffix. For example, an ERROR_METRIC of ERROR:BASE_QUALITY:GC_CONTENT will produce an extension '.error_by_base_quality_and_gc'. The suffixes can be found in the documentation for ERROR_VALUE and SUFFIX_VALUE.
arguments.name: --OUTPUT

arguments.summary: The prior error, in phred-scale (used for calculating empirical error rates).
arguments.name: --PRIOR_Q

arguments.summary: The probability of selecting a locus for analysis (for downsampling).
arguments.name: --PROBABILITY

arguments.summary: The interval between which progress will be displayed.
arguments.name: --PROGRESS_STEP_INTERVAL

arguments.summary: Whether to suppress job-summary info on System.err.
arguments.name: --QUIET

arguments.summary: Reference sequence file.
arguments.name: --REFERENCE_SEQUENCE

arguments.summary: display hidden arguments
arguments.name: --showHidden

arguments.summary: A fake argument used to show the options of STRATIFIER (in ERROR_METRICS).
arguments.name: --STRATIFIER_VALUE

options.summary: Puts all bases in the same stratum. Suffix is 'all'.
options.name: ALL

options.summary: The GC-content of the read. Suffix is 'gc'.
options.name: GC_CONTENT

options.summary: The read ordinality (i.e. first or second). Suffix is 'read_ordinality'.
options.name: READ_ORDINALITY

options.summary: the base in the original reading direction. Suffix is 'read_base'.
options.name: READ_BASE

options.summary: The alignment direction of the read (encoded as + or -). Suffix is 'read_direction'.
options.name: READ_DIRECTION

options.summary: The read-pair's orientation (encoded as '[FR]1[FR]2'). Suffix is 'pair_orientation'.
options.name: PAIR_ORIENTATION

options.summary: The properness of the read-pair's alignment. Looks for indications of chimerism. Suffix is 'pair_proper'.
options.name: PAIR_PROPERNESS

options.summary: The reference base in the read's direction. Suffix is 'ref_base'.
options.name: REFERENCE_BASE

options.summary: The read base at the previous cycle, and the current reference base. Suffix is 'pre_dinuc'.
options.name: PRE_DINUC

options.summary: The read base at the subsequent cycle, and the current reference base. Suffix is 'post_dinuc'.
options.name: POST_DINUC

options.summary: The length of homopolymer the base is part of (only accounts for bases that were read prior to the current base). Suffix is 'homopolymer_length'.
options.name: HOMOPOLYMER_LENGTH

options.summary: The length of homopolymer, the base that the homopolymer is comprised of, and the reference base. Suffix is 'homopolymer_and_following_ref_base'.
options.name: HOMOPOLYMER

options.summary: The scale of homopolymer (long or short), the base that the homopolymer is comprised of, and the reference base. Suffix is 'binned_length_homopolymer_and_following_ref_base'.
options.name: BINNED_HOMOPOLYMER

options.summary: The flowcell and tile where the base was read (taken from the read name). Suffix is 'tile'.
options.name: FLOWCELL_TILE

options.summary: The y-coordinate of the read (taken from the read name) Suffix is 'y'.
options.name: FLOWCELL_Y

options.summary: The x-coordinate of the read (taken from the read name) Suffix is 'x'.
options.name: FLOWCELL_X

options.summary: The read-group id of the read. Suffix is 'read_group'.
options.name: READ_GROUP

options.summary: The machine cycle during which the base was read. Suffix is 'cycle'.
options.name: CYCLE

options.summary: The binned machine cycle. Similar to CYCLE, but binned into 5 evenly spaced ranges across the size of the read.  This stratifier may produce confusing results when used on datasets with variable sized reads. Suffix is 'binned_cycle'.
options.name: BINNED_CYCLE

options.summary: The number of softclipped bases the read has. Suffix is 'softclipped_bases'.
options.name: SOFT_CLIPS

options.summary: The insert-size they came from (taken from the TLEN field.) Suffix is 'insert_length'.
options.name: INSERT_LENGTH

options.summary: The base quality. Suffix is 'base_quality'.
options.name: BASE_QUALITY

options.summary: The read's mapping quality. Suffix is 'mapping_quality'.
options.name: MAPPING_QUALITY

options.summary: The number of bases in the read that mismatch the reference, excluding the current base.  This stratifier requires the NM tag. Suffix is 'mismatches_in_read'.
options.name: MISMATCHES_IN_READ

options.summary: The current reference base and a one base padded region from the read resulting in a 3-base context. Suffix is 'one_base_padded_context'.
options.name: ONE_BASE_PADDED_CONTEXT

options.summary: The current reference base and a two base padded region from the read resulting in a 5-base context. Suffix is 'two_base_padded_context'.
options.name: TWO_BASE_PADDED_CONTEXT

options.summary: Whether or not duplicate reads were used to form a consensus read.  This stratifier makes use of the aD, bD, and cD tags for duplex consensus reads.  If the reads are single index consensus, only the cD tags are used. Suffix is 'consensus'.
options.name: CONSENSUS

options.summary: The number of Ns in the read. Suffix is 'ns_in_read'.
options.name: NS_IN_READ

options.summary: The number of Insertions in the read cigar. Suffix is 'cigar_elements_I_in_read'.
options.name: INSERTIONS_IN_READ

options.summary: The number of Deletions in the read cigar. Suffix is 'cigar_elements_D_in_read'.
options.name: DELETIONS_IN_READ

options.summary: The number of INDELs in the read cigar. Suffix is 'indels_in_read'.
options.name: INDELS_IN_READ

options.summary: The number of bases in an indel Suffix is 'indel_length'.
options.name: INDEL_LENGTH

arguments.summary: One or more directories with space available to be used by this program for temporary storage of working files
arguments.name: --TMP_DIR

arguments.summary: Use the JDK Deflater instead of the Intel Deflater for writing compressed output
arguments.name: --USE_JDK_DEFLATER

arguments.summary: Use the JDK Inflater instead of the Intel Inflater for reading compressed input
arguments.name: --USE_JDK_INFLATER

arguments.summary: Validation stringency for all SAM files read by this program.  Setting stringency to SILENT can improve performance when processing a BAM file in which variable-length data (read, qualities, tags) do not otherwise need to be decoded.
arguments.name: --VALIDATION_STRINGENCY

arguments.summary: VCF of known variation for sample. program will skip over polymorphic sites in this VCF and avoid collecting data on these loci.
arguments.name: --VCF

arguments.summary: Control verbosity of logging.
arguments.name: --VERBOSITY

arguments.summary: display the version number for this tool
arguments.name: --version

description: Program to collect error metrics on bases stratified in various ways.
name: CollectSamErrorMetrics (Picard)
